info.title: Gloat Customer API
info.description:
This document covers the data models and the APIs exposed by Gloat.

Before starting out, make sure you have the necessary fields for authenticating to the APIs, namely: your tenant ID and your API key.

Please note that all these endpoints are subject to quotas and rate limits. Standard API keys are limited to 1,000 calls per day and 100 per hour. If you require more, please contact your Gloat representative. Some endpoints might be marked as costing X credits, which means they count as a multiple of the number of calls they received.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Endpoints related to service, authentication and connectivity

tags.name: Outbound
tags.description: Hooks to be implemented, which Gloat can be configured to call on certain events. The payloads are defined here; the URLs are to be defined with the implementation specialist or customer success representative.

get.description: Returns a successful response, if authorization succeeded

get.summary: Fetch user IDs, optionally filtered by some attributes
get.description: Retrieve list of user ID's according to filters

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: User status to filter by

parameters.name: manual
parameters.description: If true, only manually uploaded users will be returned

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Return only the user having this exact email address

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: how many users to skip from beginning

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: how many users to return (max 1000)

400.description: Bad request - unknown status | non positive numbers (offset, limit) | limit exceeded

post.description: Update or insert users to Gloat - single or bulk

patch.description: Update user's status or custom fields

400.description: Bad request - missing payload | too many terminations | invalid status

post.description: Simulates user onboarding; typically should not be required in real-world scenario as users do it themselves

parameters.description:
Job status to filter by:
  * `OP` - open
  * `CL` - close
  * `CA` - closed for applications
  * `PE` - pending
  * `IN` - invisible
  * `PA` - open pending approval
  * `DE` - deleted
  * `AR` - archived

parameters.description: The numbers of items to return

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Job status to filter by:
  * `OP` - open
  * `CL` - close
  * `CA` - closed for applications
  * `PE` - pending
  * `IN` - invisible
  * `PA` - open pending approval
  * `DE` - deleted

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: how many jobs to skip from beginning

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: how many jobs to return (max 1000)

error.example: invalid list of status to check

post.description: Update or insert job structure in Gloat

400.description: Bad request - invalid job structure data

post.description: Update or insert a candidacy in Gloat

allowInsert.description: If true, candidacy will be created if missing. If false, will be ignored and treated as success.

suppressRejectionEmail.description: If false and the update triggers the creation of a rejection action, then Gloat will send a rejection notice to the candidate. If true, a rejection notice will not be sent.

new_external_id.description: updates external id only for existing candidate

400.description: Bad request - invalid parameters | invalid candidacy structure data | invalid status

404.description: user or job of candidacy does not exists

suppressRejectionEmail.description: If false and the update triggers the creation of a rejection action, then Gloat will send a rejection notice to the candidate. If true, a rejection notice will not be sent.

400.description: Bad request - invalid payload | invalid candidacy structure data | invalid status | candidacy not found

parameters.name: candidacy_id
parameters.description: required 1 of - candidacy_id | job_id & user_id | external_id

parameters.name: job_id
parameters.description: required 1 of - candidacy_id | job_id & user_id | external_id

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: required 1 of - candidacy_id | job_id & user_id | external_id

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: required 1 of - candidacy_id | job_id & user_id | external_id

400.description: Bad request - invalid payload | invalid candidacy structure data | invalid status | candidacy not found

get.description: Retrieve list of candidacies by given status

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: how many candidacies to skip from beginning

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: how many candidacies to return (max 1000)

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Retrieve candidacies whose status last changed date equal or greater than received date

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Retrieve candidacies whose status last changed date equal or less than received date. Must be provided with start_date (max days range is 62)

400.description: Bad request - invalid payload | missing required params | invalid status | invalid vendor | non positive numbers (offset, limit) | limit exceeded max | invalid date format or input

updateExisting.description: If true, existing location IDs would be updated to reflect the latest info. If false, only new locations would be created, but existing ones would not be updated even if their information is different.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: ID of user for whom recommendations are to be provided

get.description:
Return short descriptions of entities (jobs, roles, people) according
to a free textual query
Quota: Costs 5 credits.

parameters.name: user_id
parameters.description: The user's id

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Text to search for (max 200 characters)

parameters.name: language code
parameters.description: Language of entities to return. Entities will be returned only in this language and in English.

400.description: Bad request - missing user id | missing user | missing search query

error.example: triggered a search without a external user id

403.description: Bad request - not authorized user | language not available

post.description: Called when a new candidacy is created, or when its status is updated

200.description: successful operation. If external_id is returned in the json response, Gloat will use this ID as 'external_id' in future calls to updates.

get.description: __In planning__ Used by Gloat to synchronize the list of top skills or desired skills entered by the user on another platform.

job_status.description:
Job status:
  * `OP` - open
  * `PE` - pending
  * `CL` - closed
  * `CA` - closed for applications (invisible for imob)

description.example: Perform medical and surgical treatments for eye conditions
Examine, diagnose, and treat patients eyes.

level.description:
language proficiency level:
  * `BA` - Basic
  * `AD` - Advanced
  * `FL` - Fluent
  * `NL` - Native Level
  * `NT` - Native

user_status.title: User Status
user_status.description:
User Status:
 * `AC` - Active
 * `TR` - Terminated
 * `IA` - Inactive
 * `SU` - Suspended
 * `AP` - Approved
 * `RQ` - Requested
 * `DE` - Deleted

description_html.example: In this course, you will learn Python. It is expected that you're proficient in at least one other programming language.

language.description: Language for fields: link, title, description, item_image, item_video

type.description:
Learning Item Type:
 * `NO` - Unknown
 * `CS` - Course
 * `CL` - Curriculum
 * `AR` - Article
 * `BO` - Book
 * `VI` - Video
 * `AS` - Assessment
 * `PO` - Podcast
 * `PA` - Pathway
 * `PL` - Plans
 * `JO` - Journey

languages.description: Languages on which the learning item is suggested

related_labels_and_tags.description: Array of labels and tags objects which related to learning oppourtunity

related_skills.description: Array of skills objects which related to learning oppourtunity

related_items_id.description: Array of learning items objects which related to learning oppourtunity

translations.description: translations for learning presentative data. key- language code, value- translation object

description.example: En este curso, aprender Python. Se espera que domines al menos otro lenguaje de programacin.

extra_info.description: if the learning item is of type pathway, this field will contain all the pathway steps

type.description:
Permission type:
 * `A` - Authorized (Read & Write)
 * `R` - Read
 * `W` - Write

name.example: Allow users to manage role assignments

description.example: Organizational operational team with the highest level of permissions

status.description:
User Status:
 * `AC` - Active
 * `TR` - Terminated
 * `IA` - Inactive
 * `SU` - Suspended
 * `AP` - Approved
 * `RQ` - Requested
 * `DE` - Deleted
